alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 4:01PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Clinton, northern Grand Isle and northwestern Franklin Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 400 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rouses Point, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chazy, Alburgh Village, Champlain, Rouses Point, Alburgh, Isle La Motte, Highgate, Swanton, Shad Island, Alburg Tongue, King Bay, Ransoms Bay, Mud Point, Alburgh Springs, Long Marsh Bay, Kelly Bay, Metcalfe Island, Perry Mills, Windmill Point and Reynolds Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
